intro: Notoceras bicorne var. hispanicum, commonly known as the Spanish horned bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, inflated, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Its two horn-like protrusions on the calyx are a notable botanical feature. It blooms in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators with its vibrant blue or purple hues.
